    level="1"

>
[Harpoon Bolt](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1589)
</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Outlaws of Alkenstar</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Conjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=33" />
<trait label="Consumable" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=36" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #179: Cradle of Quartz](/Sources.aspx?ID=122) pg. 77</row>

**Price** 15 gp

<row gap="medium">
**Ammunition** round

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

This iron spike can be fitted into the barrel of a two-handed [firearm](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=16) that doesn't have the [scatter](/Traits.aspx?ID=413) property with an Interact action. The spike is attached to a 50-foot-long coil of rope held in a simple spool that can be attached to a weapon's barrel. The weight and awkward balance of the bolt and its spool reduce the [range](/Traits.aspx?ID=248) of the weapon by 10 feet when fired. A creature hit by a _harpoon bolt_ takes normal damage from the shot and must succeed at a DC 18 Fortitude save. On a failure, the _harpoon bolt_ becomes lodged in its body.

Once a _harpoon bolt_ is lodged, a creature can remove the harpoon bolt with a DC 18 check to [Escape](/Actions.aspx?ID=79) or [Force Open](/Actions.aspx?ID=34), but on a failure, the creature takes 1d4 piercing damage. As long as the _harpoon bolt_ remains lodged, the creature can't move more than 50 feet away from you. You can attempt to [Trip](/Actions.aspx?ID=40) a creature by tugging on the rope attached to the harpoon bolt, even if it isn't within your reach, but if you fail this attempt, the bolt rips free, causing 1d4 piercing damage to the target but releasing it from the bolt. If you reload, drop, or fire the firearm again, the creature is no longer limited in its movement. Once a _harpoon bolt_ is removed from a creature, the bolt, its rope, and the spool all decay away, consumed by the same magic that empowers the unusual ammunition to function in the first place.

</column>
